Curran,

I apologize, I sometimes 'leap before looking'! There are very few=
 
dealers that one must be careful of. Asking a lot of questions, 
getting =
a lot of opinions is critical for my survival along with the 
other 'newbee=
s'. But, the dealer that sold me this piece (19 & 20 
photos)was not honest=
 with me. I ask the right questions and got 
incorrect answers. As I said, =
"I have learned from this experiance." 

The Saotome has a Shakudo rim.

Th=
ank you very much,

Elliott

PS; I admit making an ass out of myself someti=
mes.....I hate when 
that happens.

ordy knows it pains me to go through the process

olutely hate to even try! This

lly good

ned to let an auction

> of items... the=
y take a greater % than any dealer I
> know.
>     As the tsuba come back f=
rom Japan, I'll just put
> them out at Tampa sword show and possibly Chicag=
o--
> but ultimately a few of them will probably end up with
> a dealer.
> =

> So go easy on the dealers. Many are good people who
> provide a service =
to buyers and sellers. There are 2
> or 3 I call friend.
> 
> Curran

s. The 'Saotome' have a shakudo edge?
